Package javaFinal

Class Arrow

java.lang.Object
javaFinal.GameObject
javaFinal.Arrow
public class Arrow
extends GameObject
the arrow object, the player spawns these based on the bpm
Author:
jonah

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Arrow​(int _direction)
    direction of incoming arrow specified by the constants UP DOWN LEFT RIGHT
    Arrow​(int _direction, double _speed)
    same as [Arrow(int) but also allows a speed to be specified.
    Arrow​(int _x, int _y)
    this is here for testing, dont use this

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void create()
    create step, handles direction and sprite.
    java.lang.String getName()
    this is to get a string version of the class name, which has actually been replaced by this.getClass().getName();, which works way better, not needing someone to update the name of the object every time
    java.awt.image.BufferedImage makeImagePartiallyTransparent​(int amount, java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
    same as makeImageTransparent()
    void makeImageTransparent()
    this is from a dark time where i tried to rewrite the rendering, i'm too scared to delete it, but its probably not being used
    void paint​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d, java.awt.image.BufferedImage imageLayer)
    this handles all cool effects that go on per arrow
    void step()
    all arrow logic, score increase is handled here instead of at the player to prevent the player from cycling through the steplist each frame.

    Methods inherited from class javaFinal.GameObject

    checkCollision, checkCollision, paintGUI

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      public void step()

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      this is to get a string version of the class name, which has actually been replaced by this.getClass().getName();, which works way better, not needing someone to update the name of the object every time
      Overrides:
      getName in class GameObject
      Returns:
      the name of the object in a string

    • paint

      Parameters:
